text: Cape Pillar seen from Cape Hauy track Cape Pillar is a location in southern Tasmania, on the Tasman Peninsula in the Tasman National Park, adjacent to Tasman Island. It is notable as a coastal feature of the Dolerite landscape of the area. It has been captured in illustrations as early as 1824 and later It is the location of a rare casuarina Allocasuarina crassa. It has been an area where whales have been sighted It is a reference point on the coast for mapping by Australian navy hydrographic service ==Notes== Category:South East coast of Tasmania Category:Tasman National Park
title: Cape Pillar
